awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Classification and Characterization  of Braided Tensor Categories
awd_abstract_narration: This project is concerned with classifying semisimple,                     braided tensor categories that are generated by a single object X               with a prescribed decomposition of the tensor square of X with                  itself.  The principal investigator will also work on the                       question of strictness of braided categories and their                          characterization in terms of balancing phases.                                       A category is a collection of objects, together with a                     collection of maps and a rule of composition of maps.  One                      example is the set of functions on subsets of the real line using               the usual composition of functions.  Categories were originally                 defined to fill a foundational role in mathematics.  However,                   current research in category theory is concerned with categories                with structure.  This area has potential impact on a number of                  different areas of mathematics, as well as theoretical physics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
